key_channel_insights.line_content: 97.37% of fares are identical between OTAs and Hawaiian Airlines, indicating strong parity across these channels.
MSE consistently offers lower fares on 60.37% of itineraries compared to Hawaiian Airlines, showcasing its pricing competitiveness.
Over 97% of GDS prices match Hawaiian Airlines, highlighting alignment and consistency.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: The vast majority of fares, 97.37%, matched between Hawaiian Airlines' website and OTAs last week, indicating consistency in distribution channels.
A small but notable 1.88% of fares were not found on OTAs, which could signal potential distribution gaps.
Only 0.75% of fares were higher on OTAs compared to Hawaiian Airlines' direct website pricing, showing limited pricing inflation in this channel.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: There is a consistent high percentage of price parity (97.37%) across OTA and airline channels in the latest week.
Instances where OTA pricing is higher than direct website remain limited at 0.75% of observed cases, showing strategic adherence to pricing policies.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: As all observed points of origin are within the US, price observations are consistent across this key market.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For US-origin trips, 97.37% align closely with Hawaiian Airlines' direct website pricing, maintaining competitive integrity.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings maintain price parity with a 96.51% match rate, demonstrating strategic pricing alignment near departure.
Far-out bookings also show strong matching, with 99.33% of prices aligned between OTAs and the direct channel.

mse_highlights.line_content: The majority of itineraries (60.37%) were priced lower on MSE than on HA's own site last week, highlighting MSE's competitive pricing power.
38.29% of prices remained the same between HA's website and MSE, indicating consistent alignment in pricing strategies across channels.
The incidence of MSE having higher prices than HA's site is minimal at 0.81%, with a declining trend over the month.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: MSE consistently offered lower prices on 60.37% of itineraries last week, though this frequency has decreased by 6.21% from last month.
The frequency of prices being the same on both MSE and HA increased by 7.03% over the last month. This suggests a convergence trend.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul flights frequently see lower prices on MSE, representing 57.60% of cases last week, but the difference is diminishing by 6.64% month-over-month.
MSE offers lower prices on 87.65% of long-haul itineraries, a slight decrease of 1.76% compared to previous months.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Flights originating from the US show a high frequency of lower prices on MSE (60.37%) compared to HA's own site, with a slight reduction in this trend over the past month (-6.21%).

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For trips booked on short notice ('Close In'), 59.08% of fares are cheaper on MSE, yet this figure has decreased by 9.02% over the last month.
For advance bookings ('Far Out'), MSE retains a lower fare advantage 63.00% of the time, maintaining a stable competitive position with only slight variations.

gds_highlights.line_content: The GDS channel aligns almost perfectly with Hawaiian Airlines' website, with over 97% of prices remaining identical week-on-week.
Instances where the GDS channel offers lower prices are exceedingly rare, at less than 0.1% across all dimensions, showing little competitive advantage.
Prices on the GDS channel are higher than the airline's website in about 0.8% of evaluated cases, indicating a minor premium positioning.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: An average of 1.24% of website offers are not matched on the GDS channel, indicating a small gap in offer availability.
Approximately 98% of prices in the GDS channel mirror those on Hawaiian Airlines' website, showcasing strong consistency.
GDS prices surpass website prices in about 0.8% of cases, slightly reducing competitive value.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: North American routes demonstrate remarkable pricing consistency, with 97.9% of GDS fares matching Hawaiian's website.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 98% of GDS prices match Hawaiian Airlines' direct offerings within the US, reflecting stable pricing practices.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings overwhelmingly align with website pricing (97.2%), indicating synchronized offer management.
Far-out bookings largely align (99.3% same), though occasional discrepancies prevail, with up to 0.3% GDS pricing higher.
